intro: Ferulago nodosa subsp. nodosa, commonly known as the nodular ferulago, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its medicinal properties have been studied for potential use in traditional herbal remedies.
